raw_text:
Sony PSP console hits US in March
 
 US gamers will be able to buy Sony's PlayStation Portable from 24 March, but there is no news of a Europe debut.
 
 The handheld console will go on sale for $250 (£132) and the first million sold will come with Spider-Man 2 on UMD, the disc format for the machine. Sony has billed the machine as the Walkman of the 21st Century and has sold more than 800,000 units in Japan. The console (12cm by 7.4cm) will play games, movies and music and also offers support for wireless gaming. Sony is entering a market which has been dominated by Nintendo for many years.
 
 It launched its DS handheld in Japan and the US last year and has sold 2.8 million units. Sony has said it wanted to launch the PSP in Europe at roughly the same time as the US, but gamers will now fear that the launch has been put back. Nintendo has said it will release the DS in Europe from 11 March. "It has gaming at its core, but it's not a gaming device. It's an entertainment device," said Kaz Hirai, president of Sony Computer Entertainment America.
llama3.2:1b: Sony's PlayStation Portable (PSP) console is scheduled to launch in the US on March 24 for $250.
The first million consoles sold will include Spider-Man 2 on UMD.
llama3.2:3b: US gamers can buy the Sony PSP console starting March 24 for $250, coming with Spider-Man 2 on UMD discs if sold within the first million units.
The handheld console features games, movies and music, wireless gaming support, and will enter a market dominated by Nintendo's DS.
gemma2:2b: Sony's PlayStation Portable (PSP) is launching in the US on March 24th for $250 and includes a free copy of Spider-Man 2 with first million units sold.
The console features gaming, movie and music playback, as well as wireless gaming capability.
Sony aims to challenge Nintendo's dominance in the handheld market which is currently dominated by the DS.
While initially planned for a simultaneous European release, the timing has shifted.
Sony is emphasizing the PSP's broader entertainment focus rather than just its gaming capabilities.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Sony plans to debut its PSP console in the US on March 24, but there is no news of a European release.
The machine will be priced at $250 and features support for movies, music, wireless gaming, games, and movies.
The PlayStation Portable (PSP) was launched by Sony in Japan last year and has sold approximately 80 million units.
It aims to launch the PSP in Europe from March 11, but gamers are concerned that this may be delayed due to Nintendo's planned release of the DS handheld console in Europe on March 24.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Sony's PlayStation Portable console, priced at $250 (£132), will debut in the US on March 24th and come with Spider-Man 2 for the first million units sold.
The PSP competes against Nintendo's DS handheld device launched last year.
Sony is expanding its market presence to Europe from its Japan base.
qwen2.5:3b: US gamers can purchase Sony's PlayStation Portable starting March 24th for $250 (£132), with the initial million sold featuring Spider-Man 2 on UMD.
Sony claims it as a modern Walkman and has sold over 800,000 units in Japan.
The console ($250/$132) plays games, movies, and music while supporting wireless gaming.
Sony announced its US debut for March 24th but Europe launch is uncertain, with Nintendo's DS set to arrive on March 11th.
Kaz Hirai, Sony Computer Entertainment America president, describes the PSP as an entertainment device focusing on gaming core features.

Ninento has also announced it will release the DS in Europe in March.

The first million consoles sold will come with an exclusive game developed by Marvel and available on disc for UMD format.
The console will support wireless gaming, as well as playing games, movies, and music.
In contrast to its predecessor, the DS, which was released in March 2004 in the US, the PSP launches in Europe later this year.
